content.question: Which of the following changes to the demonstration would increase the angular acceleration of the disk?

choices.label: Replacing the original disk with a ring that has the same mass and radius as the disk.
Replacing the original disk with a disk that has the same mass and radius but has a density that decreases radially from its center.
Replacing the original disk with a disk that has twice the radius but the same mass as the original disk.
Exerting the force perpendicular to the edge of the disk rather than tangent to the edge.

content.answer: Replacing the original disk with a disk that has the same mass and radius but has a density that decreases radially from its center.
